Yes, the legacy of Puritanism still affects modern society in various ways. Puritanism has had a lasting impact on American culture and values, particularly in areas such as work ethic, individualism, and moralism.

The Puritan emphasis on self-discipline and personal responsibility has also influenced modern ideas of success and achievement. The idea that hard work and diligence are necessary for success, which was a central tenet of Puritanism, continues to be an important value in American culture today.

Additionally, Puritanism's strict moral code and emphasis on conformity have also influenced American cultural and political attitudes towards social issues such as morality, sexuality, and the role of government in regulating individual behavior.

In summary, while Puritanism is a historical movement that took place centuries ago, its legacy continues to influence modern American society in various ways.
